ratings.comment: I have little more to add than what has already been said. But in response to the comment below, I have a brain (A student). I'm engaged in literature (English major). And I found her as dry as everyone else did. I hated how she READ her lectures and always seemed bored. The material was interesting, but she does not present it well.

I had her for the previous spring semester and I got an A in the class.  However it was NOT due to her initiative.  It was only saved by the great TA and my own efforts.  She talks at you, and reads from tiresome speeches.  She goes very fast and gets mad if you don't answer her questions which are a pathetic attempt to make the class interactive.

ATTENTION ANYONE WHO HAS A BRAIN OR WHO IS INTERESTED AND ENGAGED IN LITERATURE. Amy Johnson may not be the lecturer that every C-average student desires. She doesn't have power points with bulleted main ideas but her class was one of my favorites. If you are advanced enough you will get a lot out of this class!! Don't let these comments deter you.

Ser lectures are 8 page written speeches NOT lectures. She talks on and on at you not to you. While she does supply notes for you (which are conveniently posted online right before exams) they are 1 page outlines of NOTHING. Attendance, luckily, is not mandatory.

TERRIBLE. Do NOT take a class from her. She was incomprehensible in lectures and very unhelpful in office hours. I rarely went to lecture because each time I went I wanted to shoot myself in the foot. You're responsible for an overwhelming # of texts--over 65! And you never discuss most things read in the class. I repeat DO NOT take her class.

I am really quite angry with the English Department for hiring such an incapable, inexperienced lecturer for required class/huge lecture. Mundane, incomprehensible lectures riddled with unnecessary multi-syllabic words; put this class off as long as you can, maybe the department will come to their senses and hire someone else.

She reads her essays in class. Her essays suck too. Really boring class, and she is extremely unhelpful. If it wasn't for the TAs bailing her out, everyone would fail. My worst experience with a class yet. Hopefully i'll get an AB tho.

OH MY GOD THIS WOMAN IS AWFUL.  Do not take 216 with her.  She reads her dense and completely incomprehensible lectures but refuses to post them on the course website and does everything in her power to make the Midterm and Final as heinous as humanly possible.  Avoid her at all costs.

Do NOT take this class from her! The woman can't lecture to save her life and Eng. 216 meets 3 days a week. She's always late to class and reads her entire lecture off of a piece of paper, which is difficult to pay attention to. She asks the class discussion style questions and gets angry when no one raises their hand.

If you have a choice DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS FROM AMY! She reads every lecture word for word from a typed speech which sounds as if it mostly comes from Wikipedia. She does not seem to enjoy teaching and can be very rude if she thinks no one is listening (though it's impossible to listen to someone READING something at you.)
